They hurt one Chinese cop, all 1.4 bn Chinese will go after them.

This photo taken on Wednesday shows a protester (left) using a sharp object against a Hong Kong police officer (right), who was trying to detain a man (center) during an illegal rally. The man suspected of stabbing the officer in the shoulder was arrested on board a flight that was about to take off for London.

Link: https://shuzheng.files.wordpress.com/2020/07/hku-1.png

DEMOCRACY’S REIGN OF TERROR

The clip doesn’t show it, but here is the background before the above video starts:

Scene is Causeway Bay district near the main Hong Kong Central Library. A group of rioters, one of them holding a US flag, had strewn bricks dug up from pavements, using them as missiles against the police, while attempting to block the traffic light junction with garbage bins, etc. When police charged, a lone policeman chases after one of them who appeared to be directing the blockade. The chase crossed the road, and the video starts.

That rioter is in red shirt. But when the police caught up with him, they both fell. Policeman is surrounded by other rioters and a bunch of Press photographers, most of who — and this is standard riot SOP — are themselves rioters disguised in the yellow Press vest. (Press passes can be obtained at HK$20 each from the US NED-funded Hong Kong Journalists Association, HKAJ, no accreditation nor vetting necessary. The HKAJ along with two political parties were organizers of the riots since last June, 2019. The vests are optional with separate payment.)

The man to watch out for is on the left hand side of the screen, appearing with others from behind the pedestrian steel railing. He is in dark grey shirt, wearing a cap and repeatedly stabs the policeman on the shoulders as the latter got up, still hanging on to the suspect. (This is dedication to work.) Red shirt manages to free himself and escaped with another friend in sleeveless T-shirt. As they ran, the ‘Press’ disperse and doesn’t intervene to help the policeman soon soaking in blood. Note, for example, a girl in yellow Press vest in front of the injured policeman, nonchalant.

None of all that is new. But contrast the situation (and events of the past) with years of Press propaganda reports (SCMP, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN), all drawn from pro-US Anglophile politicians who repeat the lie — repeated from Washington to London and in Mkini, Reuters offices — that China is suppressing all freedoms, freedom of expression, freedom of Press, silencing dissent, and that the new national security law would end HK autonomy, democracy and, with that, even more freedoms.

  • Yet, without these freedoms, these ‘democracy protesters’ (sic), continue their assault on the police, and that Causeway Bay incident was just one of 17 injuries caused on July 1, 2020. They included a policeman resting inside a parked police car that was set ablaze. Another three were injured after they were rammed by a motorcycle, flying the ISIS-like black flag from the rear seat.
  • Without those freedoms, they have the past year managed to injure more than 160 policemen, almost all ending up in hospitals, one set alight with gasoline bomb, a dozen attacked with acid.
  • Even without their freedoms, they manage to disrupt daily lives, attacked 91 subway Metros, and inflicted street terror on ordinary people, on top of arson and other terrorist acts.

But within six hours we identified that motherfucker then got him after he had cleared airport immigration, the plane door had closed, seated in his chair on a Cathay Pacific flight to London with a British National (Overseas) passport. “It is the fault of the Hong Kong University (HKU). They are the worse, they forced him, they won’t leave him alone and they don’t care if he has graduated…,” but they made him join the anti-Chinese demonstrations.

The arrested suspect, Wong, age 24, was an engineering graduate of the HKU. Structured and largely taught by Anglo-American professors using English as the sole medium of instruction, the university is a racist, poisoned, anti-Chinese institution created in the exact image of Anglo-American universities.

We Chinese have a long, long memory.

But first, we’ll hammer that fucker with at least four charges which in combination will put him away for the rest of his life. Guaranteed! Next, we will hunt down and nail all his accomplices on that day, including his HKU girlfriend. After that his university mates and teachers, including the university vice-chancellor. These days, we have just the law to deal with all of them. In serious cases such as this one, trials can be conducted outside Hong Kong without those motherfucking Anglophile judges presiding.

JAIL FOR AN ANGLOPHILE

Malaysiakini and its editor Steven Gan are on trial not because of any absence of law. There are on trial for contempt, that is, for the presence of a law that holds the sanctity and the integrity of the judicial system beyond any doubt. Arguments follow…

  • They hold in contempt not just the judiciary but all institutions of the government, including the King and the Parliament. The latest example of that contempt is given above, telling off the court to ‘be reasonable’. This means that, if Mkini and Gan are convicted, Premesh Chandran is saying, the court is ‘unreasonable’ and even restricts the freedom of speech. Premesh’s speech is clearly an attempt to assert pressure on the court and undermine its independence in favor of Mkini. He and on behalf of Mkini clearly don’t care for the underlying principle of sub-judice, and they regard themselves as superior to court decisions. That’s contempt.
  • They hold in contempt by relying not just on the spin and the omissions they commit in their so-called ‘news and views’ but also with anonymous hatchet jobs committed through an army of anonymous readers, who clearly and unmistakably, support their work financially. This sort of speech-contempt is contained in Mkini’s court argument (above top image-extract). It is that there is no such law to restrict online posting therefore Mkini can permit anything in by shifting the burden of proof for an assertion that is never falsifiable. Which is, Steven Gan didn’t know. Instead of the Christian preacher proving that God exists, Mkini’s argument requires the church congregation to prove there isn’t any. This kind of syllogism and mental somersault are passe and trite and Steven Gan must be called out — and, because they employ it, must be made to pay for the trickery. That’s contempt.
  • Mkini et al hold themselves to be accountable to nobody, other than their foreign sponsors, on the pretext-premise that freedom of the Press is above the law, indeed above everything, so that they spit at the constitution which insists all are equal before the law. They hold as their motto: ‘Speaking Truth to Power‘ as if only they have possession of the truth (whatever that is) and that, dressed as free Press, all power is theirs while all other powers are fair game to be undermined. In freedom of speech, they insist that speech is not an act, even though this is demonstrably false: ISIS, Iraq, Zakir Naik et al. That’s contempt.
  • If Steven Gan doesn’t know beforehand the existence of a contemptuous post, then he must produce the administrator who knew and who let that in. If the administrator doesn’t know, then Gan must produce the subscribers who posted those comments. Where does the buck stop? Yet he will do none of the above, again on the pretext of freedom of speech, in effect giving not only himself a free pass but also anyone who gives money to Mkini! That’s contempt.
  • There are other, extenuating circumstances that clearly indicate Mkini and Gan to be subversive forces that undermine the State of Malaysia and its position vis-a-vis the rest of the world:
    • Being started, financed, and corralled into existence by the USA, which makes regime change and international subversion of legitimate governments (Ukraine, Venezuela, Russia, China) as their corner stone of foreign policy, the foreign financing makes Mkini and Gan complicit, direct and active participants in US propaganda agenda and unlawful objectives. That’s contempt.
    • That they actively collude with the US to break international law, in crimes against humanity, to propagate self-serving foreign-armed aggression (Iran, Syria, Libya), to break normal relationships among nations and neighboring states (China, Philippines), to violate sovereignty of independent states (Venezuela, Cuba), and to foment violations of law within the borders of respective countries (China, Nicaragua, Bolivia). That’s contempt.
    • That, in cahoots with the US foreign and financial interest, Mkini attempts to influence domestic politics, thereby undermining the UN safeguards for non-interference and the UN respect for the sovereignty of other states. A Malaysian example is the 14th General Elections: Mkini colluded with US interests (such as its Department of Justice) in order to influence public perception and thereby undermine the credibility of the then Malaysian government of Najib Razak so as to totally replace it. That’s contempt.

Acting in Malaysia, which has international obligations, and bound by Malaysian laws, the activities of Mkini and Steven Gan have ramifications on Malaysia’s national prestige abroad. Following in the footsteps of Reuters and Anglo-America, Mkini weaponizes — indeed, profits from — racist hatred and hatred for indigenous governments on an international scale to serve White man’s imperialist goals. None of Mkini activities, past and present, must be tolerated anymore. Enough is enough.

The danger of Mkini doing the work of its master, the USA, is plain for all to see in Hong Kong. There it has the Hong Kong Free Press and Apple Daily, both financed and directed by the CIA ‘NGO’ front the National Endowment for Democracy (NED).

Mkini and its editors on its behalf must go to jail to serve as an example for the rest of the Press corp that the destiny of Malaysia is not for them to play with, that Malaysia doesn’t belong to Gan’s mother, that their days of acting with impunity are over, and that no matter who their rich and powerful masters may be, they are not above the law. That is, Malaysia’s judges must reassert the sovereign independence of the country they serve.

The decision of the court (below) is therefore correct! Next, go straight to jail.

The comeuppance of Mkini and Steven Gan has been long time coming…

The statue is a historical landmark in Penang and is located within the grounds of the famous Fort Cornwallis here.

It was sculpted by FJ Wilcoxson and cast at Burton’s Foundry in Thames Ditton, England. It was erected to celebrate the 150th anniversary of George Town.

THE SECOND RETURN OF HONG KONG

This is Hong Kong’s badge of security

*

Below, the actual documents, original in Chinese. Should disputes arise in interpretation, the Chinese language version will prevail.

Law is gazetted effective 23:00 hours June 30, 2020, and will cover media and Press propaganda in particular those circulated from Hong Kong, and affects individually and as group the reporter, editor and their sources even if unstated, even if the ‘source’ works as toilet cleaner at the Reuters office.

NSL in Nutshell

Formal announcement (in translation): The Law of the People’s Republic of China on Safeguarding National Security in the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region (the National Security Law) was gazetted for promulgation today (June 30) and took effect at 11pm the same day.

The Law has 66 Articles.

Principles

(…in non-legal English and shall not constitute a replacement of the original in Chinese.)

  • (1) The Office for Safeguarding National Security of the Central People’s Government (CPG) has an overarching responsibility for national security affairs relating to the HKSAR, while the HKSAR bears the constitutional duty of safeguarding national security. The CPG shall establish an office for safeguarding national security in the HKSAR;
  • (2) The NSL is a national law and applicable throughout China but tailor-made for circumstances which, because of historical reasons, are most unusual in Hong Kong, itself subject to multiple threats from all sides, undermining as a result the People’s Republic of China. In safeguarding national security, the HKSAR shall uphold the principle of the rule of law;
  • (3) The HKSAR shall establish and improve relevant institutions and their duties in safeguarding national security;
  • (4) Stipulations are made on what constitutes four categories of crimes that endanger national security and their corresponding penalties; and,
  • (5) Stipulations are made in relation to jurisdiction of cases, application of laws and procedures.

*

Applications

(general categories)

  • Under the CPG, Chinese government shall establish a distinct security department with its own personnel. Dedicated units under the jurisdiction of the department have already been established and starts work July 1, 2020.
  • A Committee for Safeguarding National Security of the HKSAR chaired by the Chief Executive will be established to take up national security affairs and bear the major responsibility for safeguarding national security. It will be under the supervision of and be accountable to the CPG.
  • Hong Kong Chief Executive can establish judges. A dedicated department under the Department of Justice is responsible for the prosecution of national security offences. Unless national secrets are involved, the trial shall be held in open court and all judgements be announced to the public.
  • News media, Press and organisations are not above the rule of law. They shall be equal before the law and, hence, subject to close monitored and their organizations and/or staff, individually or collectively liable.
  • CPG can authorize investigating serious crimes under existing laws or under the National Security Law, investigations include intercept of communication and/or covert surveillance of persons suspected, on reasonable grounds, to have involved in the commission of a national security offence.
  • Under specified circumstances, a trial may be held outside the procedures previously defined, and includes trial in-camera. Specified circumstances are:

(a) the case is complex due to the involvement of a foreign country or external elements, thus making it difficult for the HKSAR to exercise jurisdiction over the case;

(b) a serious situation occurs where the HKSAR Government is unable to effectively enforce the National Security Law; (Ed: in Chinese, the term unable includes unwilling, as had been repeatedly and previously demonstrated by Secretary for Justice Teresa Cheng) or

(c) a major and imminent threat to national security has occurred.

  • Prosecutable offences include and not limited to:
    1. inciting hatred against the legitimate national Chinese or local government, and the sovereignty and sanctity of the nation of the People’s Republic,
    2. damages and/or disruption to public/private infrastructure, including transport, electrical and electronic systems, thereby affecting essential functioning of society,
    3. secession,
    4. subversion,
    5. terrorism,
    6. spying.
  • Penalties in order of severity: minimum 3 years, 5 years, 10 years and up to life imprisonment, all without parole or good behavior-condition release. Funding anti-Chinese activities, even if it’s just a dime online, is minimum five years in slammer.
  • Like criminal law, the security law is applicable and, where practical, enforceable on foreigners resident in HK, Macau, Taiwan and mainland. Hence, the national character of the law.

*

National Security and HSBC

PS: The term ‘nationality’ is never discussed because Anglos presumed they know and they have the last word. Suffice to say, the Chinese word 国民 hold a different meaning. Consequently, the NSL also protects individual Chinese. An attack on one without provocation, without just cause, is an attack on all, that is the nation of Chinese. Meng Wanzhou is case in point, not because she is rich but because she is Chinese. This puts HSBC, its senior executives especially, liable under NSL. That, plus their money laundering past, their drug trade financing since 1841, and illicit transfer of monies to rioters, we swear they will pay. Don’t doubt the Chinese resolve to settle the score. Here’s a tip to Chinese serving HSBC: leave and disappear in the Amazon jungles.

This time last year, 2019: Anglophiles

*

Yesterday, 2020: Second Return of HK

*

How does freedom arise?

Some two or three weeks ago, the Hong Kong Police launched a YouTube site Link: https://www.youtube.com/user/HKPChannel .

In yesterday’s riots, July 1, they reported the event live, simultaneous from two or more locations, and while doing inserted announcements about where roads and areas (principally in Causeway Bay) had been blocked or closed because of the pro-US disturbances. The problem yesterday was small beer, the police had handled events 100 times worse.

In the live stream (below, 7 hours long) you can tell right off how the Press, typically Anglo-American ones, CNBC, Reuters and Mkini, lied in their reports, singularly to stick to the US spin of an anti-Chinese narrative campaign. That they believe their campaign will succeed to turn the Chinese against the authorities is because that sort of spin come from an Anglo-American (hence Anglophile) culture, facets of which you see a lot in Mkini, every day. In their culture, they regard authority as antagonistic, separate and outside of society.

Not so we Chinese. We see authorities — the police in particular — as social vanguards, with both duty and responsibility to serve us and protect us from enemies, even those within. (Also see the one from mainland China about the fireman, next clip.) Each time, each era they have lived up to the trust we place on them and expectations derived thereof. Conversely, enemies of the Chinese will be punished severely; the society demands it. Hence, the NSL.

So confident are we about our authorities that the live stream received 540,000 views within a space of ten hours.

It’s written in our old books in which freedom is such:

“Let the prince be the prince, the minister be the minister, the father be the father, the son be the son…”

The British handover of Hong Kong on 1997 July 1 was a fraud because, ask yourself this, what did White people hand over? A bunch of Anglophile motherfuckers? Where does the US want HK to go?

The title immediately above is purely rhetorical, intended to help you understand real affairs by anchoring yourself to a specific phenomenon today, which requires understanding it, truly understand, in order to know what comes next. But prediction is easy. Put a kettle of water on a fire, predict the outcome.

For our purpose we pick Kosovo because it is a short, illustrative case contained in clip below.

A precedent example is important because it gives a real life feel, coming from the past, but detached from the propaganda that surrounds us, when delivered to us by the like of Reuters and Malaysiakini. Such propaganda would be delivered under titles like, “US Senate passed a HK Autonomy Act”, “protection of human rights”, “save Malaysia” or “Stand with Hong Kong”.

Below is Kosovo as it is happening, though you won’t see it from Reuters (for obvious reasons). It’s unnecessary for our purpose to know the detail history so the nugget of information provided is sufficient: Breakup of Yugoslavia, US material and ideological support, a Kosovo ‘freedom fighter’ becoming President, Clinton, and so….

America’s Crimes Against Humanity

Now, after the above, see the next clip below. Before that…

It is intended to show that political games played, say, today, by the like of US, its agents such as Joseph Lim Guan Eng or Martin Lee or Joshua Wong (next segment) have real life consequences. These consequences are often most unexpected, and comes down on a leisurely Sunday.

By consequences we mean the price paid to play those games. This may be paid days or years later, but always paid for by other people which we typically say, ‘the innocent’. Often those consequences are innocuous. But, if you’d take the trouble, it is possible to trace backwards, to the origins, i.e. roots — empirically — to the US and the like of the Lims, Lees and Wongs.

In another phrasing, the clip below showing the family below suddenly ended. To see why, you’d have to go back to Kosovo clip. Even though happening in two different spacetime, the same unseen forces are involved, the identical forces.

The energy force that boils water a thousand years ago, still boils water today.

The Moment Death visited a Family

Clip Explanation

The distressing footage shows the moment playtime turned to death and mayhem as an airstrike struck in Iraq. Two were killed, reportedly members of the Kurdistan Workers’ Party (PKK), while the six wounded were apparently all from the same family.

Footage shows the moment they are playing in a river. Then a loud bang. It is north of Sulaimani city, a popular place for families to go on picnics.

Since June 15, Turkey conducts daily airstrikes on northern Iraq, taking over from where America left off in the latter’s efforts to break up Iraq and Syria, the latter bordering Sulaimani, as was Yugoslavia broken up, hence Kosovo, as is still being carried out in Hong Kong and Xinjiang.

印度遭中巴夾擊？

陸索20命 印軍再被巴基斯坦打死3人

才剛與中國大陸在加勒萬河谷發生衝突並喪命20人的印度軍方，近來在與巴斯坦的軍事磨擦中又吃了虧。印媒報導，22日印度和巴基斯坦軍隊在拉賈烏里縣（Rajouri）喀什米爾實控線附近再度交火，又造成1名印度士兵死亡。這是印度在近兩星期內與巴國交火而死亡的第3名士兵。

《環球時報》引述《印度快報》(Indian Express)報導，印軍的一名中校稱，巴基斯坦軍方違反停火協議，在當地時間22日下午5時30分左右開始使用小型武器和迫擊炮攻擊印軍，一位名為哈威爾達爾．卡爾基（Havildar Karki）的士兵在襲擊中受重傷不治死亡。印度軍隊也展開了報復性的還擊。

Havildar Dipak Karki made supreme sacrifice in Nowshera Sector, today morning. Deepest condolences to the family. Om Shanti 💐🙏 pic.twitter.com/aXpZaIchHh Link: https://t.co/aXpZaIchHh

— Jovial (@TranquilLqd) June 22, 2020 Link: https://twitter.com/TranquilLqd/status/1274941255382753280?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw

報導稱，當天約下午3月30分巴基斯坦也曾在印巴喀什米爾實控線的另一處地點使用了小型武器和迫擊炮進行攻擊，印度軍隊也給予回擊。

消息人士說，這次喪命的士兵是兩周以來巴國在印巴喀什米爾實控線打死的第3名印度士兵。

報導指出，印巴兩國近來在喀什米爾實控線附近頻頻交火，巴國軍方21日曾報告稱，印度軍隊違反停火協議，於20日晚間對喀什米爾地區巴基斯坦控制邊界沿線開火，導致一名13歲女童死亡，其母親和兄弟受傷。

From: https://www.chinatimes.com/realtimenews/20200612005846-260409?chdtv Link: https://www.chinatimes.com/realtimenews/20200612005846-260409?chdtv

才與陸談和 印度轉身與巴基斯坦交火 軍民死傷

從5月底以來中印邊界駐軍發生互毆衝突以來，北京一直低調應對，印方也不願讓局勢惡化，雙方最後於6月7日達成協議，和平解決邊界對峙。不料協議剛完成，印度隨即在10日晚間對與大陸關切密切的巴基斯坦開火，印方2死1傷，巴方傷亡不明。

據《印度斯坦時報》(Hindustan Times)報導，當地時間10日晚間，巴基斯坦軍隊對拉古里(Rajouri)和彭琪(Poonchi)猛烈開火，造成一名印度士兵死亡，另有2名女性平民1死1傷，印度軍隊隨後進行了報復回擊。砲擊的激烈程度使村民陷入恐慌，許多人因而逃到了鄰近的烏里(Uri)躲避。

印度媒體《Zeenews》則稱，6月10日雙方共發生了2次交火，一次在當地時間早上7時30分左右，巴基斯坦軍隊在拉古裡地區的實控線附近開火，並使用迫擊炮炮擊。另在當天晚間20時45分左右，巴基斯坦再次在喀什米爾蓬奇縣使用小武器和迫擊炮開火，印度方面也同樣朝巴基斯坦方向發起了攻擊。

5月底時印度與大陸邊境上千名士兵一度在拉達克（Ladakh）地區陷入對峙，雙方甚至發生互毆，並各有數位士兵被對方扣留，事件隨著影像在網上流傳後，引發網民熱議。但目前兩國皆受疫情影響，不願事態擴大，經多次交涉後於6月7日達成和平協議。

In HSBC meeting rooms…

How it all began: Entrapment, the invention of a crime against Huawei

HSBC CEOs EXCHANGED JAIL

TO AID USA ANTI-CHINA CAMPAIGN

In Canadian court documents: HSBC traded drug-money prosecution by the FBI in return for manufacturing a crime against Huawei, with Reuters acting as the Press tip-off.

Below, documentary on how it began: HSBC’s drug-money dealings.

*

In nearly all countries, banker-client meetings, like lawyer-client meetings are protected by law. That report, above, ought to have landed the reporter and editor in jail. Nothing happened.

But note the Reuters report had cited ‘internal investigation by HSBC’. What ‘investigation’ when the only reference in it is a set of MS power-point presentation slides used in a 2016 meeting between HSBC America and Meng Wanzhou to open a corporate bank account in California for Huawei?

Facts to note:

  • (a) What is HSBC investigating when all that there is, is Huawei opening a bank account for its fledgling American business? Do they ‘investigate’ you if your company opens a corporate account? The most that they do is called ‘due diligence’.
  • (b) What is HSBC investigating supposedly over a ‘suspected front company’ that was operating not in America but in Iran, and that was four years before the HSBC meeting, and it had no HSBC account?
  • (c) What is HSBC investigating: that Huawei dealt with Iran which is subject to neither US law nor (internationally illegal) US sanctions, both having no jurisdiction over non-US companies?

In all cases, (a) to (c), the subject matter — that is, trade with Iran — had nothing to do with the HSBC.

But, solely on the basis of that meeting, and the power-point presentation Meng made at the meeting, the crime of ‘secretly dealing’ with Iran was invented — that is selling handphones — and that was by a defunct company four years prior and which Huawei didn’t own.

See, how contrived the US justice system: they want to fix you and they can’t even create a proper fig leaf argument.

To give, however, that invention of crime a legal and public legitimacy, Reuters was thus recruited — i.e. given an ‘exclusive’ — of Huawei having ‘secret dealings’ with Iran and hiding that from the US, as if that were a fact.

Note the date of the Reuters report (image above), Feb 26, 2019, was almost three months after Meng Wanzhou was abducted in Vancouver airport on transit, Dec 1, 2018. Or to restate that time line: Having nothing on Meng, the US government invented something, anything, then have Reuters do the dirty laundry work, in order to give justification for her arrest and extradition.

Even at that point, from December 2018 (her abduction) to February 2020 (Reuters report), Meng had not been charged! She was formally charged in absentia only in July 2019 so that the next month, in August, those US charge documents could be produced and sent to Canada’s government to buttress its court case of extraditing her.

Those prosecution documents are available online. Reading through them, you can see they made direct references to Reuters as a tip-off, i.e. for alerting the US Department of Justice (DOJ) which, in turn, used the 2016 HSBC-Meng meeting as proof of attempt to cheat the US and evade sanctions.

Now, contrast Meng’s supposed crime with HSBC itself, laundering drug cartel money, spread over a decade or more, until it became untenable for US and was exposed in 2012. Not one HSBC executive was prosecuted, though the sum of money laundered through worldwide via HSBC accounts exceeded US$10 billion.

In 2016 when Reuters said HSBC conducted an ‘internal investigation’ against Huawei, the latter had also reached a deal with DOJ to pay a fine of US$1.6 billion but no prosecution, provided… this, this and that.

The same method was used against Goldman Sachs over 1MDB: no prosecution for the scam but pay a fine and help the US and its pro-US Malaysian politicians nail Najib Razak. It was time for regime change in Malaysia. To help the US drum up the case they brought in the Press, in that case, Sarawak Report and Malaysiakini and the Edge. That’s propaganda SOP; it is why you want to own Steven Gan and Clare Rewcastle-Brown. If HSBC CEOs are willing to be bought, why wouldn’t little media turds?

We Chinese are more determined than ever to see that HSBC will never last long operating on Chinese soil, and that includes Hong Kong where it has monopoly on the retail and mortgage markets. Because its CEOs work as a regime change agents for the US then they and the bank will be treated as foreign threats, undermining the interest of Chinese. We have just the kind of law and punishment for them motherfuckers — this we swear in the name of Huangdi.

History would have been vastly different had China continued the voyages: no colonialism, no White imperialism, no slavery, and no Black Lives Matter. MALCOLM X

THE ANGLOPHILE NIGGERS OF AMERICA

“The 20th Century Uncle Tom: You can always tell him apart (from the White man). He has no interest in any religion of his own. He believes in a White Jesus, a White Mary, White Angels, White Christmas. He wants to be so White that when he dies he can go to a White heaven. …

With the White man, he wants to eat with him, he wants to sleep with him, he wants to marry his woman, his daughter, sister, and if you didn’t watch him closely enough he will marry your wife.

But all this is not his fault. It’s the result of 400 years of brain washing. It has taken a man black on the outside and turned him white on the inside; his brains is white, his heart is white so that when he talks he is talking down to you — like the White man….” — Malcolm X, Speech 1963, Michigan.

A 5,000-year-old proud and accomplished nation — that is, China and the Chinese — will see the end of the Anglophiles.

We will right the wrongs of history, as much as is possible, that were committed on a global scale, for hundreds of years, enslaving millions upon millions, from the aborigines of Australia to Canada. History must be returned to its rightful path — the true people of their lands.

The point isn’t whether such justifications make sense — they are not intended for that purpose. The point, instead, is who wields the power and who has the gun to hang on to the Truth.

  • Erich Maria Remarque

    "No," he said quickly. "Never. Stay friends? Try to grow a small rose garden on the ashes of broken feelings? No, this will never work for you and me. It happens only after small affairs and it looks fake. Love should not be spoiled by friendship." * No one can become stranger than the person you once loved. * How clumsy a person behaves when he is truly in love! How quickly his self-confidence fades! And how lonely he feels; all his praised experience seems to be gone, just like fog, and he feels so weak and helpless. * Love cannot stand explanations. It requires actions. Love wants to be eternal. That is the source of the torture it causes us. * "I have always thought a woman should not tell a man she is in love with him. Her shining and happy eyes should bear witness to that." * "You have to break your principles sometimes. Otherwise they bring you no joy." * "Whatever you can’t get always seems better than whatever you have. This is the romance and the stupidity of our life." * "Nothing’s lost yet," I said. "You only lose someone when he’s dead." * Quotes from: 'Three Comrades', 'Triumphal Arch', 'All Quiet On the Western Front' and 'Life on Loan'.
